listOfBulletPoints.title: Code Daily
listOfBulletPoints.bulletContent: The number one way to learn anything is to practice frequently.

listOfBulletPoints.title: Code with Intent, Have a Plan of Action
listOfBulletPoints.bulletContent: Intent means planning what you will be coding and what is the end result so you are not wasting time wondering what is next.

listOfBulletPoints.title: Iterate, Iterate, Iterate.
listOfBulletPoints.bulletContent: Refactor or rebuild something you have done in the past helps cement what you learned in your mind and practice writing good clean efficient code.

title: You are only as great as your support system
intro: When I was raising cucumbers, I learned it's best to scaffold a trellis to support the long vines and growing buds. I harvested more cucumbers and they were bigger. The correlation is your career needs support to grow. Success does not happen in a vacuum. You need:

listOfBulletPoints.title: Coding buddies to listen as you 'rubber duck' problems
Supporters to help you find a job and even more important; to speak good about you when you are not in the room.

title: Don't underestimate the power of networking
intro: Job hunting can seem like a black hole sucking up every job application you submit. Networking can and should be an essential part of connecting your face, name, or reputation to a job application. Resources to use:
